explanation:
For a correct unreachable-code (MISRA) analysis we must know any symbols that affect control-flow or the feasibility of each branch in OS_SocketShutdown:

- BUGCHECK: Determines whether the initial Mode validation can abort/terminate the function (noreturn) or simply check; if it is noreturn on failure this affects reachability of subsequent code when Mode is invalid.

- OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_READ, OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_WRITE, OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_READWRITE: Definitions (values/bitmask vs enum) are needed to decide whether the initial BUGCHECK condition can ever be false and whether the later "Mode & ..." tests can be true/false (i.e. whether the subsequent if-blocks are reachable).

- OS_ObjectIdGetById: Prototype/semantics are required to know whether it can return OS_SUCCESS (thus making the large inner block reachable) and whether it can be noreturn/longjmp (which would make following code unreachable).

- OS_SUCCESS: Value/meaning of success return code so the condition (return_code == OS_SUCCESS) can be evaluated for reachability.

- OS_object_token_t: Type of token returned by OS_ObjectIdGetById; needed because token is used to index the object table and could influence whether OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET yields a valid/accessible stream record.

- OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET: Macro/inline definition (how it maps token to a table entry) and possible side-effects are required to decide whether the obtained pointer is a valid stream pointer or can be NULL/invalid (affecting reachability of subsequent branches).

- OS_stream_table: The global table the macro indexes; its shape/size and invariants influence whether an index obtained from token can refer to a legitimate record (affects whether inner branches are reachable).

- OS_stream_internal_record_t: Structure layout and field types (socket_domain, socket_type, stream_state) are needed to reason about evaluation of tests on those fields and whether the branches that inspect them are feasible.

- OS_SocketDomain_INVALID: Value and semantics to determine if the test (stream->socket_domain == OS_SocketDomain_INVALID) can be true or false (reachability of that branch).

- OS_SocketType_STREAM: Value/semantics to evaluate the stream-type test and combined condition with stream_state (reachability of the stream-type related branch).

- OS_STREAM_STATE_CONNECTED: Mask/value used in the connected-test ((stream_state & OS_STREAM_STATE_CONNECTED) == 0) — needed to know which states make that conditional true/false.

- OS_STREAM_STATE_READABLE, OS_STREAM_STATE_WRITABLE: Masks used when clearing bits after a successful Impl call; needed to check whether those statements can execute (i.e. whether the if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS) branch can lead to observable writes) and whether those bit-clearing statements are reachable.

- OS_SocketShutdown_Impl: Prototype/semantics (including whether it is noreturn or may modify token/stream_state) are required because a callee that does not return or that alters the stream/token could make subsequent statements unreachable.

- OS_ObjectIdRelease: Prototype/semantics (especially whether it can be noreturn or have side effects that influence reachability) are needed to determine whether the release call itself or code after it can be reached.

Collectively these symbols provide the control-flow and data invariants (return-code values, token-to-table mapping, field values and masks, and any noreturn callees) necessary to determine which lines/branches in OS_SocketShutdown can ever be executed and therefore whether any code is truly unreachable.
